AVSEC ORDER No. 04 / 2009 
 
Subject : Secondary Security Checks at Ladder Points of Aircrafts: 
 
In order to strengthen the pre-embarkation Security checks, the Secondary Security 
Checks of passengers and their cabin baggage are carried out at Ladder Points of Aircrafts. 
Some airlines have expressed difficulty in implementing it due to inclement weather or  lack 
of suitable infrastructure at the existing airports. Therefore, the following instructions are 
issued for compliance by all concerned: 
 
i) 
During normal weather condition, the Secondary Security Checks shall be carried 
out at the ladder points of the aircraft; 
ii) 
In case of inclement weather, when the aircraft is parked on a remote stand, the 
Secondary Security Checks shall be carried out in the terminal building just 
before the passengers get into the bus. For this purpose, necessary facilities will 
be made available by the airport operators. Passengers so frisked shall be escorted 
by airlines staff up to the aircraft in order to prevent contamination of security 
cleared passengers; and  
iii) 
When the aircraft is docked in aerobridge, Secondary Security Checks shall be 
carried out on any portion of the aerobridge, preferably on the concrete portion.  
 
 
2. 
This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA) in exercise of 
powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934 delegated to him vide Government of 
India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 dated July 3, 1997.
